WRITING.TEXT:
Go to areas where there are humanoid camps. They usaully have weapon and armor racks scattered throughout the camp between the tents etcetera.
Loot all the stuff of the racks and a lot of them are on the ground as well.
Many of these 'white' items will be intricate or ordinate. Rinse and repeat between a couple of camps.

WoW refugee here, enjoy this game immensely. More so than WoW...
Played Morrowind, Oblivion and Skyrim. This game is not exactly like them, it can't be due to being an MMO. In some cases it is much better, in some cases the single player TES games are better especially if you like modding and giving yourself godlike powers.
All in all, ESO grew on me and I would rather play it with my friends then fire up Skyrim and wander alone. Both are excellent games though, depends what you want / need.

On a Windows host, which opensource drivers are available to Fedora to behave well (USB3, multiple network cards, 4K display) when running as a guest?
If the host is Linux, sure then it is a perfect world, unfortunately in most of my client's setups, that is not the case.

My friend, I think we are misunderstanding each other here.
I do not want Fedora to include any Virtualbox code at all. All I want to do is to be able to compile and install the drivers in Fedora.
In order to do that these packages are needed:
gcc kernel-devel kernel-headers dkms make bzip2 perl
They are all from the default Fedora opensource repo. With them the guest drivers can be compiled and Fedora will run as a well behaved guest operating system.
Getting those package installed when there is no network connection to the guest is a huge impairment.
Including those packages will not defile Fedora with Dark Side proprietary code. They are from the official open repo.

I don't want Fedora to make that the default.
My first line in my original post was:
It need not be the default image, but I think a lot of people use Fedora in Virtualbox (due to having to have multiple test environments).
I.E. It will be most appreciated if there was a GNOME desktop development Fedora spin optimised for virtualisation as a guest OS.
I am pretty sure plenty users run Fedora and CentOS and RH in VMs and not on the bare metal purely to ease testing and development.

HyperV requires Windows 10 Professional, Virtualbox on the other hand don't. In my country the price difference between Windows 10 Pro and Home is about USD 126.00 when converted. Multiply that by 5 development machines for a small design company, and it adds up.
Quoting from https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/virtualization/hyper-v-on-windows/reference/hyper-v-requirements
Operating System Requirements
The Hyper-V role can be enabled on these versions of Windows 10:
Windows 10 Enterprise
Windows 10 Professional
Windows 10 Education
The Hyper-V role cannot be installed on:
Windows 10 Home
Windows 10 Mobile
Windows 10 Mobile Enterprise
Seeing as most clients runs Windows, having the LAMP stack on a Linux Virtualbox inside a Windows host makes testing a lot easier (yes some companies still only use Internet Explorer and won't install anything else).
Also Virtualbox is opensource and free, and it works really well. The issue is not Virtualbox, the issue is getting all the kernel development files and gcc installed without proper guest support.

WRITING.TITLE: Please release a normal desktop version with GNOME that includes everything needed to build the Virtualbox guest additions Add-ons
WRITING.TEXT:
It need not be the default image, but I think a lot of people use Fedora in Virtualbox (due to having to have multiple test environments).
And installing all the extras from the official repos just to get display, folder sharing and in some cases networking to work is an unnecessary step, especially seeing that Fedora desktop is marketed as the developers desktop.
EDIT: Some more information to substantiate this request:
I do not want Fedora to include any Virtualbox code at all. All I want to do is to be able to compile and install the drivers in Fedora.
In order to do that these packages are needed:
gcc kernel-devel kernel-headers dkms make bzip2 perl
They are all from the default Fedora opensource repo. With them the guest drivers can be compiled and Fedora will run as a well behaved guest operating system.
Getting those package installed when there is no network connection to the guest is a huge impairment. Including those packages will not defile Fedora with Dark Side proprietary code. They are from the official open repo.

While this can definitely make a web server seem offline, it seems highly unlikely that this was the actual cause. The time slot is not a typical mass user time slot unless it is a deliberate denial of service attack.
My guess is that they where doing maintenance on the site.

I think that the site was in maintenance mode this morning (central Europe time) which would make it very early just after 00:00 Monday morning in the USA where the servers are probably hosted.
For a very high trafficking site that time slot is the best time to do maintenance and take it of the web for a couple of hours as the impact to the majority of the users will be minimal.

Different part of the brain. The portion of the brain responsible for speech is a lot closer to the brain stem (most primitive part of the brain) compared to where memories are stored.
See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Broca's_area

It is a remnant from our past evolutionary tree.
Today we don't rely on the canine teeth as much as a couple of thousand years ago (perhaps couple of hundred thousand).
But because evolution is very slow process especially when it comes to evolving away from a previous beneficial selection state, we still have the canines.
Should we continue to eat all these highly processed soft food we may still evolve our teeth away completely :)
EDIT: So the answer to your question is that we don't have them now as a necessary survival trait, but we use to depend on them in the past for defence and ripping meat off bones (like what WRSaunders said below).

They say it to cover themselves should something go wrong and you end up being allergic to it and go into anaphylactic shock. It becomes a bit more difficult to sue them if they warned you.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anaphylaxis

It is there as an overflow. So if you forgot the plug in and the water open, the water should drain through there instead of overflowing the sink and onto the floors.
The hole connects directly to the down drain pipe.

It is a combination of the volume, surface area and density of bread.
Since bread has a very low density per volume, a lot of the microwaves hit the exposed surface area of the bread and due to its sponginess microwaves also travel through bread much more rapidly, than through for instance meat that is much more compact.
So the area of 500 grams of bread that can be hit by microwaves is a lot larger than the area of 500 grams of steak for instance.

WRITING.TITLE: ELI5: How did banks keep track of legitimate withdrawals before the electronic age?
WRITING.TEXT:
It seems that the old paper savings booklet banks used in the past would have made bank withdrawal fraud extremely easy.
How did banks protect themselves against exploits back in the era before electronic banking? And how did your savings information get propagated between various branches of the same bank or even worse different banks? Could you only ever draw money from your home branch? What would you do in case of an emergency while on holiday for example?
EDIT: added some more info to substantiate the question.

Hi friend, I am on the PC, so not sure how to do it on all platforms.
On PC you can bind a key to hide the HUD. I made mine the Backspace key because it was bound to nothing.
So in game get the view you want and then press Backspace to hide the HUD (if that is the key you bound). With the HUD hidden you press print screen key.
Screen shot will be saved in your my documents folder.

WRITING.TITLE: Possible ways of dealing with the insta-kicks from Group Finder while still levelling.
WRITING.TEXT:
For all the greatness and awesome in game community this game have, the one thing that ZOS needs to address is how the group finder tool works.
I get it that max level characters do not want to run a *normal* dungeon with people below 50. Everybody wants a smooth quick run, and having to carry people may not be the best use of your time. However it is real douche bag invoking behaviour to just kick others as soon as the group formed.
There are multiple ways ZOS can fix this issue, some of these may be:
1. Level scale the Group Finder so that only people from level 10 - 49 will be grouped up and all level 50 toons will be only grouped with other level 50 toons. Yes it may take a bit longer to get into a group but at least you will not be insta-kicked and then sit with a 15 minute debuff. 2. Hide every ones level so that there is no way to see each other's level when grouped for a normal dungeon. 3. Make it work like WoW's system where it is not possible to vote kick anybody before the first boss in a dungeon was downed. 4. Make group finder unavailable until level 50. Extreme yes, but less infuriating than having to deal with multiple 15 minute debuffs every 50 minutes continuously because some high level douche bags where selfish.
Apologies if this post came of as antagonistic, but the way the group finder tool currently functions is causing a very bad experience and image of the multiplayer aspect of this great game to new players.
It is leveling gear, I am only level 26 at the moment. Started playing a week or so ago. It is part Knightmare and part Schalks set pieces.
Thanks will try it out.
Yeah that is it.

Not being antagonistic here but from this post I gather you will not find joy in this game that requires some input from a player's side in order to get stuff.
Maybe stick to the easy games where you get all your gear and skills handed on a silver platter or perhaps even bought in P2W games?

Because if you don't tank or heal and only stay out of the red stuff on the floor with a block here and there, all dungeons available while leveling can be easily done as DPS, as ranged DPS it is a joke how easy it is.
BUT to tank or heal requires a deeper knowledge of the game and specific boss mechanics. So don't queue as tank or healer if you are new to the game (I know you didn't).
